body:
There is a networking e2e test with the It() description:
```
   "should provide unchanging, static URL paths for kubernetes api services"
```
This test performs GETs from the Kubernetes API using various paths,
including "/logs". This test for a GET using path "/logs" should be
skipped for provider type "skeleton", since this API path is apparently
unsupported for this provider type. (This should also cover the case of
using --provider=local on the command line, since this translates to
provider type skeleton).

<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
> /kind bug
/kind feature

/sig testing
/area ipv6

**What happened**:
If you run e2e networking tests with --provider=local (probably also happens for --provider=skeleton, since --provider=local on the command line translates to provider type "skeleton"), the test with description:
```
   "should provide unchanging, static URL paths for kubernetes api services"
```
fails when it attempts a GET from API server using path "/logs".

**What you expected to happen**:
This test case should be skipped for --provider=local or --provider=skeleton

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Run e2e tests using --provider=local, e.g.:
```
go run hack/e2e.go -- --provider=local -v --test --test_args="--host=https://<INSERT-API-SVC-IP>:443 --ginkgo.focus=unchanging"
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:
I would like to include this test case in a suite of e2e tests used for:

- Qualifying kubernetes IPv6 releases (kube alpha release + cherry-picked IPv6 PRs)
- (Coming soon) Upstream IPv6 gating tests

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Latest master
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: VirtualBox cluster, Ubuntu 16.04.1 host, CentOS 7 guests
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS 7
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 3.10.0-514.26.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 4 15:04:05 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools:
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.
labels.name: kind/feature

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: e2e check for "/logs" API path should be skipped for provider skeleton
